availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
State of New York
Erie County ss:

I, James S. Gibbs, residing in the City of Buffalo, County and State aforesaid, appointed by the Governor of the State of Kentucky, a Commissioner in and for the State of New York, to take the acknowledgements and proof of deeds and other instruments of writing under seal, to be used and recorded in the said State of Kentucky and to administer oaths and affirmations, pursuant to the Laws of the said State of Kentucky, in relation to the appointment of Commissioners of deeds and of the said State; do solemnly swear, that I will support the Consitution of the United States and the Constitution of the State of Kentucky, and that I will faithfully execute, perform and discharge all the duties of such commissioner, under and by virtue of the laws of said State of Kentucky according to the best of my ability.
Subscribed and sworn to this 5th day of June 1865. before me

Chas. Daniels
Justice of Supreme Court.

Comr Deeds
Oath of Jas. S. Gibbs
New York
filed 8th June/65
